page.title: 03FARM MACHINERY
page.content: In our area most farms have at least one{tractor(most likely a Ford, an {International or a Massey Ferguson), } and attachments such as{ploughs, {harrows and link-boxes}to go with it. The larger farms may also have {combines}for gathering barley,{forage} {harvesters}for grass and{potato {picking machines.} Solid manure is scattered over the fields by a{spreader,}and slurry is sprayed from a{tanker.}These are both pulled and worked by tractors. Some farms have machines which never leave the farmyard, like{milking } {machines}that are housed in parlours, and{dryers}for barley.
